How does ESAT-6 behave under different p: It forms stable dimers at neutral pH and tetramers at acidic pH.
It forms monomers at neutral pH and dimers at acidic pH.
It forms tetramers at neutral pH and hexamers at acidic pH.
It forms trimers at neutral pH and pentamers at acidic pH.
What is the potential application of the: Designing and characterizing nanobodies targeting the SARS-CoV-2 spike protein.
Developing vaccines against SARS-CoV-2 using ESAT-6 as a model.
Creating antiviral drugs that inhibit SARS-CoV-2 replication.
Engineering SARS-CoV-2 spike protein variants for enhanced immune response.
What is the primary focus of the study i: Understanding the biochemical properties of ESAT-6 and its self-association behavior under different pH conditions.
Investigating the genetic mutations in ESAT-6 that lead to drug resistance.
Exploring the role of ESAT-6 in vaccine development against M. tuberculosis.
Analyzing the impact of ESAT-6 on the immune response in humans.
What techniques were used to characteriz: Biolayer interferometry (BLI) and hydrogen-deuterium exchange mass spectrometry (HDX-MS).
X-ray crystallography and nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) spectroscopy.
Cryo-electron microscopy and surface plasmon resonance (SPR).
Fluorescence resonance energy transfer (FRET) and isothermal titration calorimetry (ITC).
